column4: U.S. fund managers on hunt for companies that won't be 'Amazon'ed' away
column5: By David Randall     NEW YORK  July 12 Amazon's long shadow is falling on retailers previously thought immune to the threat of e-commerce  forcing U.S. fund managers to rethink their approach to consumer stocks by focusing on companies whose businesses cannot be upended by the online giant.     At the core of the problem: Amazon.com Inc  once thought of as a place to buy books and household goods  is on track to become the largest apparel retailer in the United States by 2017  accord

column4: Low aluminum prices hurt Alcoa second-quarter profit

column4: Dow  S&P hit record closing highs on greater risk tolerance
column5: NEW YORK The benchmark U.S. S&P 500 stock index set record closing and intraday highs for the second straight day on Tuesday and the Dow Jones industrial average reached record highs for the first time in over a year as optimism about the world economy and upbeat corporate results from Alcoa boosted risk appetite.

column5: July 12 An Amazon.com Inc shopping event that the online retailer billed as its largest ever had a bumpy start on Tuesday  with some customers unable to add discounted items to their shopping carts and rival retailers aiming for a cut of the buying frenzy.

column4: U.S. fund managers on hunt for companies that won't be 'Amazon'ed' away
column5: NEW YORK Amazon's long shadow is falling on retailers previously thought immune to the threat of e-commerce  forcing U.S. fund managers to rethink their approach to consumer stocks by focusing on companies whose businesses cannot be upended by the online giant.

column4: U.S. fund managers on hunt for companies that won't be 'Amazon'ed' away
column5: By David Randall     NEW YORK  July 12 Amazon's long shadow is falling on retailers previously thought immune to the threat of e-commerce  forcing U.S. fund managers to rethink their approach to consumer stocks by focusing on companies whose businesses cannot be upended by the online giant.     At the core of the problem: Amazon.com Inc  once thought of as a place to buy books and household goods  is on track to become the largest apparel retailer in the United States by 2017  accord

column5: * Teladoc secures $50 million in debt financing from Silicon Valley Bank

column4: Teva raises second-quarter estimates
column5: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd  the world's biggest generic drugmaker  raised its adjusted profit and revenue estimates for the second quarter  sending its shares up 2 percent in after-hours trading.

column4: Teva raises second-quarter estimates
column5: July 12 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd   the world's biggest generic drugmaker  raised its adjusted profit and revenue estimates for the second quarter  sending its shares up 2 percent in after-hours trading.

column4: BRIEF-Teva Pharmaceutical expects Q2 revenue to be $4.9 bln-$5.0 bln
column5: * Sees non-GAAP EPS for second quarter is now expected to be $1.19 - $1.22

column4: Vanke in talks with Blackstone to buy property firms for $1.9 billion
column5: HONG KONG China Vanke Co Ltd  and its partners are in talks with Blackstone Group LP  and third parties to buy property firms for 12.9 billion yuan ($1.9 billion)  the Chinese developer said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Vanke in talks with Blackstone to buy property firms for $1.9 bln
column5: * Director who abstained from deal vote is employed by Blackstone

column4: China Vanke  partners plan to pay Blackstone $1.9 bln for property firms
column5: HONG KONG  July 12 China Vanke Co Ltd  said it and partners planned to pay Blackstone Group L.P.  and other third parties 12.9 billion yuan ($1.9 billion) to acquire some commercial property firms.

column4: Twitter to live-stream some Bloomberg TV programs
column5: Twitter is set to live-stream some of Bloomberg LP's television programs  the latest in a series of content deals struck by the microblogging service this year.

column4: United to write off $264 million as Newark landing slots lose value
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc warned on Tuesday it expects to write off a quarter billion dollars in assets because a U.S. regulatory decision allowing more take-offs and landings in Newark  New Jersey  diminished the value of the airlines's slots there.

column4: UPDATE 1-United to write off $264 mln as Newark landing slots lose value
column5: July 12 United Continental Holdings Inc  warned on Tuesday it expects to write off a quarter billion dollars in assets because a U.S. regulatory decision allowing more take-offs and landings in Newark  New Jersey  diminished the value of the airlines's slots there.

column4: United to write off $264 mln as Newark landing slots lose value
column5: July 12 United Continental Holdings Inc  expects to write off a quarter billion dollars in assets because a decision by U.S. regulators to allow more take-offs and landings in Newark  New Jersey  has diminished the value of United's slots there  the airline said on Tuesday.

column4: Valero buys out partner in Louisiana-Mississippi pipeline
column5: Valero Energy Corp said on Tuesday it bought Kinder Morgan Inc's 50 percent stake in Parkway Pipeline LLC  previously a joint venture between the two companies.

column4: UPDATE 1-Valero buys out partner in Louisiana-Mississippi pipeline

column4: Valero buys remaining stake in Parkway Pipeline
column5: July 12 Valero Energy Corp bought the remaining 50 percent stake in Parkway Pipeline LLC and said it would gain increased access to eastern United States by connecting the pipeline to Colonial Pipeline Co's Gulf Coast-to-U.S. Northeast system.

column4: BRIEF-Valero acquires 100 percent ownership of Parkway Pipeline

column4: Wells Fargo joins FX settlement system CLS
column5: LONDON U.S. bank Wells Fargo  has joined the more than 60 banks worldwide that process currency transactions directly through the settlement systems run by U.S.-based CLS  the two banks said in a statement on Tuesday.

column4: Xerox in talks to buy financial printer RR Donnelley: sources
